title: Chili Sin Carne
instructions: Crumble the planted and sauté in a large pot with olive oil until browned, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté diced onions, bell peppers, and jalapeños until softened. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, and oregano. Toast the spices for 30 seconds.
Add crushed tomatoes, drained kidney beans, black beans, and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, add the browned planted, and simmer for 20-25 minutes until flavors meld. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, topped with sour cream, shredded cheese, fresh cilantro, and a squeeze of lime.
